title: FTR: New kind of PY3 travis crash
body:
From https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/1722/commits/325405e026290cf1732165b692acaabcb932da99 trying to merge into master

Will rerun tests, but wanted to put on record in case it does not come back.

````
======================================================================
ERROR: datalad.crawler.nodes.tests.test_annex.test_add_archive_content_tar(False,)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.4.6/lib/python3.4/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 198, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 892, in newfunc
    reraise(*exc_info)
  File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.4.6/lib/python3.4/site-packages/six.py", line 686, in reraise
    raise value
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 868, in newfunc
    func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 458, in newfunc
    return t(*(arg + (d,)), **kw)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/crawler/nodes/tests/test_annex.py", line 186, in _test_add_archive_content_tar
    output_add = list(annex({'filename': '1.tar'}))  # adding it to annex
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/crawler/nodes/annex.py", line 469, in __call__
    out_json = _call(self.repo.add, fpath, options=self.options)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/cmd.py", line 493, in call
    return f(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/gitrepo.py", line 301, in newfunc
    result = func(self, files_new, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/annexrepo.py", line 1409, in add
    to_be_added_recs = self.add(files, git=True, dry_run=True)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/gitrepo.py", line 301, in newfunc
    result = func(self, files_new, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/annexrepo.py", line 1402, in add
    raise e
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/annexrepo.py", line 1384, in add
    files, git_options=git_options, update=update)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/gitrepo.py", line 301, in newfunc
    result = func(self, files_new, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/gitrepo.py", line 850, in add
    to_options(update=update) + ['--verbose']
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/annexrepo.py", line 1134, in _git_custom_command
    return super(AnnexRepo, self)._git_custom_command(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/gitrepo.py", line 301, in newfunc
    result = func(self, files_new, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/support/gitrepo.py", line 1384, in _git_custom_command
    expect_fail=expect_fail)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/cmd.py", line 591, in run
    cmd, env=self.get_git_environ_adjusted(env), *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/travis/build/datalad/datalad/datalad/cmd.py", line 454, in run
    raise CommandError(str(cmd), msg, status, out[0], out[1])
datalad.support.exceptions.CommandError: CommandError: command '['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'add', '--dry-run', '-N', '--ignore-missing', '--verbose', '1.tar']' failed with exitcode 128
Failed to run ['git', '-c', 'receive.autogc=0', '-c', 'gc.auto=0', 'add', '--dry-run', '-N', '--ignore-missing', '--verbose', '1.tar'] under '/tmp/datalad_temp_tree__test_add_archive_content_tarlo9l6m7i'. Exit code=128. out= err=fatal: Unable to create '/tmp/datalad_temp_tree__test_add_archive_content_tarlo9l6m7i/.git/index.lock': File exists.
Another git process seems to be running in this repository, e.g.
an editor opened by 'git commit'. Please make sure all processes
are terminated then try again. If it still fails, a git process
may have crashed in this repository earlier:
remove the file manually to continue.
````
